You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
ENHANCE YOUR CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE WITH SALESFORCE FEEDBACK MANAGEMENT
Create a Data Map for Survey Responses

Create a data map that creates a Task record based on survey responses. You can show the details of the record in a timeline. For example, you can create a standard survey to collect feedback and then create a data map that automatically creates a Task record based on a participant's response. You can then view the responses in a timeline.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: both Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
Available with the Feedback Management - Starter and Feedback Management - Growth licenses


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or update data maps:	
Create and send survey permissions
Read and Create permissions for objects whose records the data map creates or updates
Read and Create permissions for fields that the data map creates or updates
Read permission for records with mapped ID

To view data maps:	Read permission for the Survey object
From the App Launcher, find and select Surveys.
Click New.
Enter a name for the survey, and then select Standard Survey.
Edit the Welcome page.
Add a page, and then as Net Promoter Score type question, enter Rate your experience!.
Edit the survey’s Thank You page, and then save the survey.
Click Advanced Settings.
Click Merge Field Variables, and then Object Variables for Merge Fields.
In Participant Object, for Variable Name, enter ContactName.
For Object, select Contact, and then save your changes.
Click Back to Builder, and save the survey.
Click Advanced Settings, and then click Survey Data Mapping.
Click Add Data Map, and then name the mapping.
In Action Type, select Create Record.
From the Target Object dropdown, select Task.
Define your target objects and values.
FIELD	INFORMATION TYPE	VALUE
Description	String	Detractor Alert: Unhappy Customer (Low NPS)
Survey NPS Score	Response to Question	Rate your experience!
Priority	Picklist	High
Status	Picklist	Not Started
Task Details	String	The customer has given a low NPS score (< 7) in the recently concluded survey. We need to speak to the customer to understand his concern.
Response	Response Fields	Response ID
Name ID	Participant Record	Contact ID
NOTE In this example, Survey NPS Score, Task Details, and Response are custom fields.
Select Based on conditions, and specify these values.
Select Conditions: All conditions are met
Logic Type: Response to Question
Question: Rate your experience!
Operator: is less than
Response: 7
Save the mapping and the survey.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Creating a Data Map for Survey Responses
